meanings.definition: The act of leading or commanding a group or team.
meanings.sent1: Her captaining of the soccer team inspired everyone to work together.
meanings.sent2: The captaining of the ship was crucial for a successful voyage.
meanings.sent3: The penguin's captaining of the fish-catching squad was quite impressive.
meanings.sent4: His captaining of the debate team was like a skilled conductor leading an orchestra.
meanings.sent5: The captaining of the space mission required great responsibility and skill.

meanings.definition: To act as a captain or leader.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys captaining the chess club during tournaments.
meanings.sent2: He will be captaining the team in the upcoming championship.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel captaining the nut-gathering expedition was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: Captaining the project felt like steering a ship through stormy seas.
meanings.sent5: Captaining the group discussion required clear communication and decision-making.

meanings.definition: The position or role of a captain.
meanings.sent1: The captaining of the army was a challenging but honorable role.
meanings.sent2: In the play, the captaining was played by a talented actor.
meanings.sent3: The cat's captaining of the naptime committee was met with purring approval.
meanings.sent4: She took on the captaining of the class project with enthusiasm.
meanings.sent5: The captaining of the spaceship demanded quick thinking and bravery.
